contentrichtext.text: '''Richard Smith''' may refer to: ==Sport== * [[Richard Smith (rugby player)]] (born 1973), former Wales international rugby union player * [[Richard Smith (rugby league)]] (born 1973), rugby league player * [[Richard Smith (footballer)]] (born 1970), former footballer with Leicester City, Cambridge United and Grimsby Town * [[Richard Smith (American football)]] (born 1980), American football player * [[Richard Smith (American football coach)]], former defensive coordinator for the NFL's Houston Texans * [[Richard Shore Smith]] (c. 1878–1953), American football player and coach * [[Rick Smith (American football executive)]], general manager of the Houston Texans * [[Rick Smith (ice hockey)]] (born 1948), professional hockey player * [[Ricky Smith (American football)]] (born 1960), former American football cornerback * [[Richard Smith (field hockey)]] ==Politicians== *[[Richard Smith (MP for Arundel)]], MP for [[Arundel (UK Parliament constituency)]] *[[Richard Smith (MP)]], MP for Devizes, 1402 *[[Richard Smith (died 1516)]], MP for Reading *[[Richard Smith (died 1581)]], MP for Newcastle-under-Lyme *[[Richard Smith (fl.1584)]], MP for Cricklade *[[Richard Smith (politician)]], former Liberal MPP for Nipissing, Ontario *[[Richard M. Smith]], legislator from Mineral Point, Wisconsin ==Other== * [[Richard Abel Smith]] (1933–2004), British Army officer * [[Richard Baird Smith]] (1818–1861), British engineer officer * [[Richard Bowyer Smith]] (1837–1919), Australian inventor * [[Richard B. Smith]] (1901–1935), wrote the lyrics to the popular song "Winter Wonderland" * [[Richard D. Smith]] (born 1949), American chemist, Director of Pan-omics and Proteomics Research at Pacific Northwest National Laboratory * [[Richard E. Smith (marine biologist)]], researcher on [[Pygmy seahorse]]s * [[Richard Gordon Smith]] (1858–1918), British traveler, sportsman and naturalist * [[Richard G. Smith (engineer)]] (born 1929), director of NASA's John F. Kennedy Space Center * [[Richard G. Smith (geographer)]], British geographer * [[Richard Harbert Smith]] (1894–?), professor and researcher of aeronautical engineering * [[Richard Harrison Smith]] (born 1937), choral conductor, arranger and composer * [[Richard J. Smith]] (born 1948), American dentist, anthropologist, head of graduate studies at Washington University in St. Louis * [[Richard Langham Smith]] (born 1947), British academic, head of music at the Open University * [[Richard Mills Smith]] (born 1946), American editor and journalist, Chairman of ''Newsweek'' magazine * [[Richard Norton Smith]] (born 1953), U.S. Presidential historian * [[Richard O'Brien]] (born 1942), real name Richard Timothy Smith, TV presenter * [[Richard Penn Smith]] (1799–1854), American playwright * [[Richard Sharp Smith]] (1852–1924), English then American architect * [[Richard William Smith]] (born 1959), Canadian prelate of the Roman Catholic Church * [[Richard Smith (bishop)]] (1568–1655), English Catholic Bishop, titular of Chalcedon in Asia Minor * [[Richard Smith (Continental Congress)]] (1735–1803), lawyer and New Jersey delegate to the Continental Congress * [[Richard Smith (diplomat)]] (born 1934), Australian diplomat, Australian High Commissioner to the United Kingdom * [[Richard Smith (East India Company officer)]] (1734–1803), Commander-in-Chief, India * [[Richard Smith (editor)]], British medical doctor, former editor of the ''British Medical Journal'' * [[Richard Smith (mining engineer)]] (1783–1868), English-born mining engineer and politician in Nova Scotia * [[Richard Smith (musician)]] (born 1971), English-born fingerstyle guitarist in Nashville, Tennessee * [[Richard Smith (screenwriter/director)]], Scottish screenwriter, film director, BAFTA-winning writer of ''Trauma'' * [[Richard Smith (settler)]] (1596–1666), one of earliest settlers of Rhode Island * [[Richard Smith (silent film director)]] (1886–1937), American silent film director * [[Richard Smyth (theologian)]] (or Smith), (1499–1563) English Catholic scholar, Regius Professor of Divinity at Oxford * [[Richard Smith (writer)]], front page writer at VetVoice, the blog of VoteVets.org * [[Ric Smith]] (Richard C. Smith, born 1944), Australian public servant * [[Ricky Smith (Doctor Who)]], fictional character in British TV series ''Doctor Who'', played by Noel Clarke * [[Rickey Smith (singer)]], contestant on ''American Idol'' ==See also== * [[Dick Smith (disambiguation)]] * [[Richard Smyth (disambiguation)]] * [[Rick Smith (disambiguation)]] {{hndis|Smith, Richard}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Smith, Richard}}
